items.title: Watch: Fed Chair Jerome Powell's Full News Conference | WSJ

items.title: Building Prior Authorization Systems for Healthcare Payors with Amazon Bedrock

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this session shows how to leverage Amazon Bedrock foundation models to build an intelligent prior authorization system for healthcare payors that meets CMS regulatory requirements and improves operational efficiency. AWS Engineers and the AWS Generative AI Innovation Center present an architectural approach combining advanced NLP with healthcare-specific workflows to automate Local Coverage Determinations, analyze medical documentation, and produce explainable prior authorization recommendations to help meet CMS-0057-F timelines while maintaining compliance
bullets: Demonstrates building prior authorization systems using Amazon Bedrock foundation models
Combines advanced natural language processing with healthcare-specific workflows
Automates processing of Local Coverage Determinations (LCDs) and complex medical documentation
Generates explainable prior authorization recommendations to support compliance
Targets meeting CMS-0057-F timelines while improving operational efficiency and accuracy
takeaways: Adopting Bedrock-based solutions can support payors in meeting CMS-0057-F timelines
Integrating advanced NLP with domain workflows enables automation of LCD processing
Explainable recommendations help maintain regulatory compliance and decision transparency
The approach focuses on improving operational efficiency and accuracy for prior authorizations

items.title: TTEC accelerates AI deployment and revenue streams with Google Cloud Consulting

ai.summary: Based on the available description, TTEC partnered with Google Cloud Consulting to rapidly prototype and deploy AI solutions that unlocked entirely new revenue streams. Sreeni Alakappan says they leveraged GenAI and Google Cloud's infrastructure to streamline operations, boost developer productivity, and compress their digital transformation timeline.
bullets: TTEC worked with Google Cloud Consulting to accelerate AI prototyping and deployment.
Used GenAI alongside Google Cloud infrastructure to streamline operations.
Efforts boosted developer productivity.
The initiative unlocked new revenue streams for TTEC.
Consulting compressed the digital transformation timeline and expanded business ambitions.
takeaways: Robust cloud infrastructure is foundational for faster GenAI prototyping and deployment.
Engaging cloud consulting can compress transformation timelines and accelerate time-to-value.
Operational streamlining and higher developer productivity can enable new revenue-generating services.
Partnering with a cloud provider can help scale AI ambitions without extending internal timelines.

items.title: Year-end toolkit: Strengthening audit committee collaboration

ai.summary: Based on the available description… This episode of PwC’s year-end toolkit covers how finance teams can strengthen collaboration with audit committees, streamline year-end accounting and reporting, and address emerging topics such as AI oversight, enterprise risk management, cyber risk, and proxy disclosures. PwC partners Stephen Parker and Diana Stoltzfus discuss practical governance and communication priorities for boards and management as they close the year.
bullets: Strengthening management/audit committee communication and collaboration (1:18).
Key year-end accounting and reporting issues finance teams should be ready to address (10:10).
Oversight of AI: assessing risks, opportunities, and necessary controls (15:02).
Enhancing enterprise risk oversight and navigating evolving cyber risks in the age of AI (21:33, 27:35).
Elevating proxy disclosures to reflect governance and year-end considerations (36:05).
takeaways: Ensure audit committees receive clear, timely updates on AI initiatives and related control frameworks so board-level oversight can keep pace with operational change.
Integrate AI and cyber risk considerations into enterprise risk management and year-end reporting to avoid gaps between operations and governance.
Prioritize documentation and disclosure readiness (including proxy disclosures) around transformation projects and material year-end issues to support transparent governance.
